title: Dashboard crashes when viewing wireless network topology
content:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to Network Topology view
2. Select 'Wireless' filter
3. Click on any access point
4. Dashboard becomes unresponsive and eventually crashes

Expected behavior: Should display detailed AP information
Actual behavior: Browser tab freezes, then crashes

Environment:
- PlexNet v2.3.1
- Chrome 119.0.6045.159
- Windows 11 Pro
- Network: 45 access points, 1200+ connected devices

Stack trace attached. This is blocking our wireless network monitoring capabilities.

Priority: Critical
Assignee: dev-team
Labels: bug, wireless, dashboard, crash
author: Lisa Wang

comments.author: dev-team
comments.content: Can reproduce the issue. Appears to be a memory leak in the topology renderer when handling large wireless networks.

title: Add support for SNMP v3 authentication
content:
As a network administrator, I need to monitor devices that require SNMP v3 authentication with SHA-256 hashing and AES-256 encryption.

Currently, PlexNet only supports SNMP v1/v2c and basic v3 with MD5/DES. Modern enterprise networks require stronger security protocols.

Requirements:
- SHA-256 authentication
- AES-256 privacy
- Support for multiple authentication protocols
- Backward compatibility with existing SNMP v1/v2c

This is needed for compliance with our enterprise security standards.

Priority: High
Assignee: backend-team
Labels: feature, snmp, security, enterprise
author: Marcus Johnson

comments.author: backend-team
comments.content: Working on the implementation. Planning to use net-snmp library for v3 support.

comments.author: qa-team
comments.content: Test cases drafted. Need to verify compatibility with major network vendors (Cisco, Juniper, etc.)

title: Mobile app shows incorrect bandwidth usage
content:
The mobile app displays bandwidth usage that's 3-4x higher than the actual usage shown in the web dashboard.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open mobile app on iOS/Android
2. View bandwidth usage for any device
3. Compare with web dashboard for same device/time period

The discrepancy seems to be in the data aggregation logic. Mobile app appears to be double-counting some traffic.

Environment:
- Mobile app v1.2.1
- iOS 17.2 / Android 14
- Backend API v2.3.1

This is causing confusion for field technicians who rely on the mobile app for quick checks.

Priority: High
Assignee: mobile-team
Labels: bug, mobile, bandwidth, data-accuracy
author: Sophie Patel

comments.author: mobile-team
comments.content: Found the issue in the data aggregation query. The mobile API was including both inbound and outbound traffic twice. Fix implemented.

title: Implement automated network discovery
content:
We need an automated network discovery feature that can:

1. Scan IP ranges to find active devices
2. Auto-detect device types (routers, switches, servers, etc.)
3. Identify device capabilities and supported protocols
4. Create device profiles automatically
5. Update inventory without manual intervention

This would significantly reduce the setup time for new deployments and help maintain accurate network inventories.

Technical requirements:
- Support for CIDR notation for IP ranges
- SNMP-based device identification
- LLDP/CDP protocol support
- Integration with existing device database
- Background scheduling for periodic scans

Priority: Medium
Assignee: backend-team
Labels: feature, automation, network-discovery, inventory
author: Tom Anderson

comments.author: product-team
comments.content: This aligns well with our roadmap for reducing deployment friction. Should prioritize for Q1.

title: Database connection pooling causing memory leaks
content:
We've identified a memory leak in the database connection pooling mechanism. Memory usage grows steadily over time, eventually requiring service restart.

Analysis shows:
- Connection pool size not being properly managed
- Prepared statements accumulating without cleanup
- No connection timeout enforcement

This affects both the main application and background workers. Memory usage increases by ~50MB per day under normal load.

Environment:
- PostgreSQL 15.3
- Connection pool size: 20
- Application server: 8GB RAM

Logs show increasing 'out of memory' errors during peak usage.

Priority: Critical
Assignee: infra-team
Labels: bug, database, memory-leak, performance
author: Kevin Zhang

comments.author: infra-team
comments.content: Reproducing the issue in staging environment. Connection pool configuration needs adjustment.
